daily_summary.headline: Aurora and Starlink Launches Dominate the Day

top_events.title: Aurora G1 Storm
top_events.description: A G1 geomagnetic storm is expected, offering a good aurora viewing opportunity for high-latitude observers.
top_events.action: Check viewing conditions if you're above 60° latitude.

top_events.title: Falcon 9 Starlink Group 6-104 Launch
top_events.description: SpaceX's Falcon 9 will launch the Starlink Group 6-104 mission, deploying 28 satellites for its mega-constellation.
top_events.action: Watch the live stream for the latest updates.

top_events.title: Falcon 9 Starlink Group 17-26 Launch
top_events.description: Another Falcon 9 launch for SpaceX's Starlink constellation, deploying 25 satellites.
top_events.action: Tune in to the live stream for coverage.

alerts.title: G1 Geomagnetic Storm Alert
alerts.message: A G1 geomagnetic storm is expected on February 23, 2026, with a Kp index of 5. This offers a good aurora viewing opportunity for observers at high latitudes.
alerts.action_required: Check viewing conditions if you're above 60° latitude.

opportunities.recommendation: Good viewing opportunity for high-latitude observers. Worth checking if you're above 60° latitude and skies are clear.
Possible aurora at high latitudes. Best for northern locations (65°+). Worth checking if conditions are optimal.
